UPDATED: JUN 18, 2017 Kapsel is drinking a Bommen & Granaten Rioja Barrel Aged (2015) by Brouwerij De Molen

Winne aromaty, karmelki, suszone owoce, hmmm troche dziwne aromaty (3,75)
Kapsel is drinking a Bommen & Granaten Rioja Barrel Aged (2016) by Brouwerij De Molen

Rozczarowany wersją 2015 postanowiłem otworzyć 2016 i to jest to czego oczekiwałem. Suszone owoce, trochę suszonych jabłek, karmel, winne nuty, jest wanilia, słodkie z cierpko wytrawnym posmakiem. Świetne piwo. (4.25)

De Molen Bommen & Granaten (Rioja BA)
Barley Wine
748415

Lukt: Frukter, krydder, malt, noe vinøst og en anelse røyk.
Utseende: Mørk gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Frukter, krydder noe vinøst.
Hvor: Melkebaren, Sandnes.

Aroma is full of dark fruits - fresh (cherries) as well as dried (a bit of prunes and some raisins) along with caramel and a tiny bit of vanilla. Taste has lots of depth and complexity with notes of dried fruits mixing with notes coming from barrel aging. Since rioja has a lot of oak notes in its profile it adds even more of this feeling to the beer which makes it a very interesting beer with huge barrel influence. The only downside in my opinion is quite high carbonation and a bit too much of alcohol appearing on the palate.

Botella 33 cl en el Artesana la Felguera 19..05..2017. (r119). Color ámbar bronce oscuro intenso con espuma beige oscuro. Sabores maltosos acaramelados algo tostados, bastante intensos con toques de. Maderas empapadas en vinos tintos. Ligeros afrutados y uvas. Cuerpo intenso bastante alicorada y sensación de vinos aňejos. Cierta densidad y espumosa. Bastante buena para repetir sin duda.
From a bottle Cloudy reddish amber Woody cidery aroma Dry smokey flavors and a rich smooth body. A strange burnt note at the end.

330ml bottle pours out a crisp amber topped with a tan head. Nose is pit fruit great barrel notes and toffee caramel sweetness. Taste is more of the nice malts pit fruit barrel presents and a nice end.
Potężne, słodkie, wyklejające. Trochę aromatów winnych. Rodzynki, suszone owoce, śliwki. Słodycz jest bardzo fajnie przełamana beczką.

(bottle) hazy deep amber-brown colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of green walnuts, pears and acetone, with some notes of peanut husks, banana skins and caramel. flavour is mostly the same, slightly more adjusted and woodsy, with lots of walnuts and old oak, some more acetone, a touch of caramelized pear and a rather ethanolic finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation. disappointing.

Bottle 330ml (BB 03.09.2040). Dark amber colour with beige, small head, good lacing. Aroma is sweet, malty with dried fruits notes a little bit like sweet wine, very intense and very nice. Sweet, malty, fruity, wine with delicate dry and sour finish. Beer is full body but not so sweet as I expected when smelled it. Good balanced without booze but you can feel the power inside because of warming. Really good drinkable like for so sweetness, definitely for long evening.

33cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Reddish brown colour with white head.
Aroma is red fruits, raisins, caramel.
Taste is cherries, raisins, sweet, grapes, alcohol, slightly sour.
Full body, soft carbonation.

Pite z beczki i z butelki a potem... znów z beczki i z butelki i z beczki i...Piwo, które otwiera człowieka na aromaty zarezerwowane dla najlepszych win i destylatów dojrzewających w beczkach. Nadal uważam, że to tylko piwo... ale zdecydowanie należy poświęcić mu czas i uwagę przy degustacji.

Bottle from Bottle Shop, Bjerringbro. Pours golden amber with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is malt, caramel, fruits, toffee, alcohol, wood. Full body. Soft carbonation. Light bitter warming finish. Excellent.
Smells extremely winish. Classicaly sweet and slightly bitter. Light Brown. Really Noble. Awesome.

Barwa miedziana, piana beżowa. W aromacie czerwone owoce, suszone owoce, karmel, truskawki (?). W smaku również truskawa (nie wiem skąd, ale jest wyraźna), suszone owoce, karmel, wanilia. Mega dobry BW.

Sweet and toasted malty aroma and taste, sweet with notes of treacle, caramel, toffee, some brown sugar, dried fruited medley, some spices, red wine soaked wooden accents into the finish.
Bardzo fajny zapach, masę suszonych owoców pokroju śliwek, fig. W smaku jest bardzo słodkie ale w przyjemny sposób

Aromat kwaskowy, leśno-owocowy, winny, chlebowy, zbożowy, słodowy przechodzący w miodowość. Można generalnie powiedzieć że aromat beczkowy i refleksy drewniane doskonale wyczuwalne. W smaku czuć potęgę - na początku likierowe, ciężkie, owocowe - czarna porzeczka z kwaśnymi wiśniami i cierpkim akcentem, dochodzi do tego posmak konfitur śliwkowych, alkohol słabo wyczuwalny. Nie powiem że pijalne ale nawet nie powinno - jest idealne. Po ogrzaniu dominuje już smak 40 letniego odfermentowanego wina z truskawek. Genialne piwo, prawdopodobnie najlepsze jakie w życiu piłem.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Almost no foam, but it?s all about smell and complexity here. Pronounced smell with lots happening: candied fruits, vanilla, citrus, red fruits, figs. Very balanced: carbonisation, bitterness, sweetness are all spot-on. Smooth and with a lot of depth. Quite an amount of complexity. Thicker mouthfeel. Oak use is not overdone, like many beers that do the same. Caramel, charcoal, vanilla, blackcurrant, chocolate, coffee, figs, cherries, hint of tobacco. Long finish.

Aromat przyjemny, słodki, są nuty półsłodkiego wina i cała masa słodkich owoców: rodzynki, suszone śliwki i wiśnie, gruszki i winogrona. Aromat bardzo bogaty. 
Wygląd: Przejrzyste, miedziane, ładna warstwa piany, nawet do centymetra zaraz po nalaniu, szybko zanika
Smak: słodkie, oleiste, likierowe, rodzynki i suszone śliwki i wiśnie, trochę winnej cierpkości. Słodycz uderza jako pierwsza, ale nie jest syropowa bo za chwilę uderza kontra w postaci beczkowych, winnych tanin, powodujących uczucie ściągania na języku. Wszystko na koniec zamyka lekka goryczka, taka pochodząca od suszonych owoców. Piwo pyszne, świetnie zbalansowane, kapitalną rolę odgrywa tu beczka po Rioja, powodując odejście z kierunku bardzo słodkiego. Mi dużo bardziej smakowało od wersji podstawowej. Kolejne świetne piwo z browaru De Molen
Pours cloudy amber. Aroma is malty, woody, alcohol, balanced, marcipan. Taste is balanced, red wine, wood, malty.
Z: Wychodzi wino, jakaś roslina/trawa/kwiat - coś miłego, ale nie wiem z czym mi się kojarzy. Słodko. S: Bardzo fajne połączenie słodyczy z lekka wytrawnością. Winny karmel.

W zapachu czerwone wino, idące nawet w stronę brandy. W smaku też beczka po czerwonym winie dominuje całość, karmel, rodzynki, alkohol bardzo przyjemnie grzeje w przełyku, poza tym niewyczuwalny. Świetne.

Beautiful aroma of dried fruits (raisins, figs, dates), caramel, fresh plums and pears.
Mostly sweet, with a bit of alcohol counter.
Full body, low carbonation/ Lovely

Ciemnomiedziane, bardzo skromna piana. Aromat to głównie jabłka, szarlotka, dojrzałe owoce w stylu fig, daktyli. Są też nuty winne, drewno. Słodkie, rodzynkowe, jabłkowe, karmelowe. Wyraźnie czuć wpływ beczki, jest wino, są taniny, ale nie jest to kompletnie dominujące. Trochę alkoholu się przebija, ale jest to poziom akceptowalny. Bardzo złożone, dobre piwo, na pewno warto trochę potrzymać w piwnicy

Draft 0.15l at Foeders Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 04.03.2017. Taste with kermis. Pour it dark ruby color with medium white head. Aroma dark red fruits, some tart feel, woody barrel notes. Taste heavy cloying sweetness, lightly sour, tart balsamic vinegar just a pinch, red fruits on the back, wooden note on the back, molasis, medium body, thick feel, soft carbonation, alcohol kick at the end, sweet after taste, long finish. OK
33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. Notes de fruits rouges et amertume très prononcée.

Wyraźnie jabłkowe, szarlotkowe wręcz, trochę ciemnych winogron, jeszcze jakieś czerwone owoce (ale nie tylko suszone), trochę rodzynek. Mocno słodkie, ale i ciut taniczne, cierpkie, w smaku niestety wychodzi alkohol. Bardzo dobry efekt zrobiła tu beczka po winie, jedno z lepszych BW.

Bommen&Grenaten
Zapach jabłuszko świeże, słodowosc 
W smaku wchodzi jabłko, potem słodycz, lekko alkohol, rodzynki. Jest owocowo, mocna słodowość, niewiele się dzieje. Ogolnie nie powiedziałbym ze jest świetny, niezłe piwo ale nic poza tym

Ciekawy aromat, lekko jabłkowy ale przebija się tez drewno i lekka słodycz. W smaku jest podstawa typowa dla barley winea, ale do tego wyraźny aromat drewna, lekko wytrawne taniny, dojrzałe owoce, posmak słodki. Bardzo ciekawe, dużo się różni od wersji bez beczki.

Aroma: red fruits - cherries, red currant. Raisins, figs. Sweet notes, wine, vanilla. Taste: red fruits, cherries, lots of cherries, grapes, figs, dates, figs, caramel, damson plum. Spices. Feeling: very sweet, flat. Superb.
Barley wine with a lot of fruity taste. Red fruits bring here sweetness and a bit of sourness, thus it makes this beer very drinkable as for barley wine

Draft. A brown beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of grapes, prunes, alcohol, caramel, and fruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, prunes, fruit, grapes, and a bit of wood, leading to a bitter finish.
From tap tap at Taphouse. A dark amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of sweetness, oak, rioja wine, caramel, malt, hops and alcohol.

Bottled 330ml. -Courtesy of and shared with Marko, thanks. Dark amber coloured with red glare, medium sized pale beige head, chestnut, alcohol and whiff of wood in the nose. Heavy sweetness, wood, caramel and chestnut with evident presence of alcohol and touch of green apple and dried fruits. Too young, just 9 weeks after bottling. Got potential.

Bottled 2016-11-23, exp. date 2041-11-23.

Bottle, poured into Teku. 

Aroma: a whole bunch of wild notes, barnyard, cowshed, brettanomyces all the way through. Red wine. Vanilla. 

Pours red to red brown, ultra hazy and muddy. Medium to big long lasting beige head. 

Heavy-medium to heavy sweetness, light to medium short bitterness. Very wineish. Tannic. Vanilla coming straight from the barrel. A definite presence of Brett yeasts. 

Medium to full bodied, medium texture, totally flat. 

Wow. One of the best barrel aged beers Ive ever drunk. A masterfully blended wine notes and barrel notes, being a whole one composition with the basic regular barley wine.
Net een Barley Wine van Hair of the dog achter de kiezen. Dus deze rating zal beïnvloed zijn door een voorbewuste vergelijking. Fruitig, jong, Rioja is merkbaar aanwezig. Leuk.

Tons of figs and raisins, then apples, caramel, wood. Almost no alcohol. Very oily and sticky.
Beczka dużo dała, zrównoważyła potężną słodycz z wersji podstawowej, fajne winne akcenty.

F: big, tanned, long lasting.
C: brown, hazy, opaque.
A: malt, dark cherries, molasses, honey, red fruits syrup, vinous, woody.
T: sampled from tap at ACBF 2017, desert red vine, red fruits, lingering alcohol, woody, hint of mint, honey, full body, low carbonation, very special and tasty, wau beer :)

Aroma: caramel, woody, raisins, malty.
Appearance: hazy amber color and white head.
Taste: woody, raisins, malty, caramel, bready, low bitterness, smooth, well-covered alcohol.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, woody finish.
Overall: Really good barley wine, I really like the idea to use Rioja Barrels, nice raisins notes.

Kolor: miedziany, zamglony.
Piana: niska, drobnopęcherzykowa, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: wyraźne aromaty wina, beczki, sporo ciemnych, suszonych owoców, daktyli, fig, lekkie melanoidyny, karmel, alkohol również delikatnie wyczuwalny, ale nie przeszkadza.
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, lekka gęstość, sporo nut beczki, wina, ciemnych suszonych owoców, daktyli, fig, rodzynek, trochę słodyczy, skontrowanej lekką cierpkością od beczki, alkohol wyczuwalny, ale nie jest drażniący.
Wysycenie: średnie, trochę w kierunku niskiego.

Bottle from Ludo, shared with ogivlado. Hazy brown-amber body, deeper, small off white head. Actually quite nice aroma, some green apples, but also full maltiness and notes of dried figs with some light young red wine. Taste... nice at first with some soft maltiness, light brown sugar, over sourish red wine notes, but slightly too light, but despite random offs and light alcohol presence, actually extremely drinkable and slightly pleasant. Some great fruitiness, berry notes that just ever so slightly turn into glue, which kinda ruins the effect. Really wish I couldve gotten another to age for 5 more years at least. This should be interesting then. Now,.. just not that great.

Bottle. Teku. Deep brown wit moderate, semi-thick, frothy, dirty-white head. Moderate head retention and poor lacing. Moderate to heavy malty aroma, caramel, candy, light to moderate wooden notes. Taste is moderate sweet, yeasty, vinous. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, finish is semi-sweet, oaky, vinous. Really nice brew.

Copper coloured with light opalescence offering a light beige fine poring head. Aromas of fresh almonds, toast, toffee, raisins, earthy, wet wood notes, acacia honey develop with a lovely dried red fruit note lurking in the back. Very finely carbonated, lightly slick offering a full body. caramel-fruity sweetness with a light fine acidic-bitterness offering a long lasting warming finish. Nice complexity to it!
Bottle. Pours brown, hazy, small head. Aroma: lots of fruits, dry plums, cherries, red fruits, carmel. Sweet, little sour, very fruity. Complex and harmonic

Slightly hazy amber color with a bit of beige head. Aroma is sweet with dried fruit notes like dates, raisins, plums and apricots. Taste starts slightly sweet with caramel and dried fruits. Light earthy bitterness on the finish. Cognac/brandy notes throughout. Medium body, slightly syrupy, light carbonation. Overall its a nice, fruity barleywine.

Wyrwało mnie z butów. Piwo absolutnie pierwszej klasy. W aromacie na pewno czuć nuty winne - wiśnie, czerwone owoce - w tym jabłka, dalej czuć karmel i toffi, następnie nuty drewniane. W smaku idealnie zbalansowane, nisko nasycone, słodkie, karmelowe, słodowe, znowuż czuć wyraźnie winny charakter - czerwone owoce. Alkohol zupełnie niewyczuwalny. Całość bardzo intensywna. Z barwy raczej jasnawe, niezła piana. Gęste i gładkie. Niesamowite!

Rating #2409 - 2016.04.07 - Bottle from CBI. Hazy brassy coloured pour, bubbly head, not much lacing. Aroma is soft fruits, caramel, vanilla, oak. Taste is a boozy , bitter concoction, not thoroughly undisguised with flavours of earth, oak, mild citrus, and toffee. Lovely.

Precioso color madera de tinte rojizo, con textura muy cremosa, igual que la espuma. Aroma añejo, madera, licor, en boca cuerpazo. Sabor intenso, con base dulce, pero en general predominio ácido, bastante alcohólica. Ciertamente recuerda vino. Final muy licórico

(bottle)
Aroma:red wine,tannic,caramel,toffee.
Appearance:copper color,medium-sized off-white head with decent durability.
Taste:sweet,flavour of caramel,red wine and tart blackberry hint,sweet malty finish,toasty aftertaste.
Palate:full body,oily texture,low to medium carbonation.
Overall:Very smooth well-made barley wine , thanks to tart notes from the barrels its more complex and easier to drink than the regular version.

Kolor bursztynowy, piwo jest mętne; piana właściwie zerowa. Aromat średnio intensywny, wybitnie słodowy. Czuć rodzynki, białe wino i nieco owoców. W smaku bardzo pełne, słodowe. Gęste, oblepia usta, słodkie. Czuć wyraźnie beczkę 
(taniny), wino, owoce suszone. Smak bardzo długo pozostaje w ustach. Goryczka zupełnie przykryta słodami. Bardzo dobry barley wine.

Aromat to białe wino i kandyzowane owoce. W smaku również winnie, później pojawiają się orzechy włoskie. Bardzo lekko się to pije jak na taki ekstrakt, alkohol rozgrzewa dosyć mocno, ale przyjemnie. Bardzo ciekawe doświadczenie, intrygujące piwo. Beczka zrobiła bardzo fajną robotę.
resin, wine, figs, little wood, nice body , and rich taste with red wine notes, good bw

Pours deep amber with thin, quickly disappearing head.
Aroma: dried fruits, raisins, wallnuts, vanilla, oak, caramel, very ripe grapes, wine. Very complex and rich.
Taste: a lot of sweetness and sourness, very delicate oaky bitterness. No sign of these 12% abv.
Full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, very long sweet finish. Aftertaste of oak and wine. 
I drank it around 6 months into my adventure with craft beer (1.5 years ago?) and I thought that is the best thing I ever tasted. I have the same impression right now. 
10/10 would drink again
Draft @ Brouwcafé de Molen. Black beer, medium head. Aroma is wine, grape, grape juice, dark fruit, malt. Taste is the same, fruit, sweet, alcohol... damn... this stuff is awesome
Bottle. Pours clear light-burgundy with no head. Aroma is raisins and dried fruits. Taste is sweet caramel, tart red berries, tart grapes, oak.
Aroma: dried fruits, dried apricot, vanilla, red wine, strawberry. Taste: dried fruits, caramel, plums, vanilla, wood, subtle alcohol warming. Small head, average lacing and low carbonation.

Bottle shared with brahs on NYE, Pours a Amber orange with small head. Nose of breaD, Sherry, caramel, dark fruit, light rust, and complex wood. Flavor most of the same. Warming in chest. Not into barley wines these days but this is nice.

Fruit punch colored brew, flat--no carbonation. Aroma is of toasty citrusy beer soaked bread crusts. The flavor is likewise toasty and fruity with rich sherry-soaked bread character. This one could probably benefit from another year or two of aging though to dry it out a bit.

Kolejny rewelacyjny BW z De Molena
Kolor- rubinowy
Aromat- karmel, wanilia, lekka winność, rodzynki, śliwki
Smak- delikatne nuty karmelu przechodzące w cierpkość Riochy. Po ogrzaniu delikatnie wanilia.
Faktura - gęsta/oleista.

Borefts Beer Festival 7th edition day 1 25/09/2016. A dark reddy amber coloured pour with a halo of light tan head. Aroma is honey, toffee, caramel, apple notes. Flavour si composed of rounded caramel and toffee, earthy apple and honey. A little vinous fruits and wood in the finish. Palate is sweet, moderate carbonation. good nice complexity.

Bottle, pours slightly clouy tea color with small and very fast falling beige head. Very intensive aroma of plums, raisins, caramel, hay, red wine, oak wood and cherry. Well balanced with high sweetness with a sour touch from the wine barrels and a hint of bitterness. Full bodied with an oily texture.
Great beer!
Backlog. Prachtige afsluiter van een mooie bierproefavond van de jongens van Beerotica. Heerlijk volle, olie-achtige barley wine met portachtige tonen.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Świetne. Figi, śliwki, karmel.

Bottle from De Caigny, bottle date 03/09/15 BB 03/11/40, large sample. Slight hazy amber to copper color, short frothy head, tiny debris. Aroma is buttery, red wine, caramel, toffee, oak wood, alcohol, mashed apples. Mashed apple sweetness, butter, alcohol. Pff, wtf. Getting kind of fed up with this crap.

Bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs; thanks DuffMan). Looks good for the style; a translucent amberish caramel with very light caramel head that slowly but steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells semi-sweet and malty with notes of caramel, hops, and oak alongside a soft vinous presence. Tastes like it smells, but with less caramel and more of a red wine presence. Mouthfeel is full-bodied and pleasantly vinous. A good take on the style.

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy dark ruby brown head with thin quickly diminishing soapy tan-like head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of caramel, dried fruit, berries, oak, vanilla, syrup and herbs. Taste starts with sweet candy sugar and toasted malt, follows by dried fruit, herbs and strong wine, mouthfeel is warming, while finish is medium grassy bitter. Full body, syrupy texture and average carbonation in palate. Delicious dessert...
Aromat czerwonych owoców wina i wanilii. W smaku słodkie, winne, słodowe z mocną goryczką. 12% dosyć dobrze ukryte. Idealne piwo do powolnego sączenia.

Bottle @ Home. Pours slightly hazy dark golden with a small offwhite head, sugary lacings. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, candy sugar, light nutty, light coconut, wood, dark fruits, alcohol. Flavor is sweet, malty, bread, caramel, wood, light tart fruit, light redwine notes, alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet and light bitter finish with warming alcohol. 281016
Bottle @ Orla holding the Hood Down, Sanderslum, 2016. Pours Deep amber with bubbles on top. Dried fruit, earth, vanilla, caramel, fudge and Wood. Warming alcohol.

Bottle @ Brought by Dedollewaitor. Pours muddy brown with off white head. Aroma of caramel, heavy malts, dark fruits, barrel, woody, cellar, fudgey caramel. Taste is quite vinous, lots fudgey caramel, vanilla, cellar, light earth, brown sugar. Quite complex vinous and sweet and dry!

Tekstura: likierowe, wysycenie niskie.
Ogólne wrażenie: pyszne piwo, bardzo mocno złożony aromat i smak, degustacyjne.

Alkohol:  11,9% obj. 
 Ekstrakt:  30% wag. 
 IBU:  30 
 Chmiele na goryczkę:  Columbus, Saaz 
 Kolor:  Ciemnobursztynowy z małymi czerwonymi odcienami. Lekkie zamglenie. 
 Piana:  Żółta, średniotrwała, drobnopęcherzykowa. Nie zostawia wielu zacieków na szkle. Szybko opada. Podczas degustacji nie towarzyszy mi żadna obrączka piwna. 
 Zapach:  Czysty, przenikliwy aromat czerwonego wina. Za nim skrada się mocna owocowość i sporo nut beczkowych.
Wanilia wyczuwalna gdzieś pod koniec bukietu. Po przelaniu do TeKu tuż nad kielichem unosi się kwaskowata woń.
Zaraz koło niej wyczuwalny jest lekki cytrus.
Pięknie pachnie! 
 Smak:  Trochę mylny był ten kwaśny aromat, gdyż w smaku piwo idzie gruntownie w słodką stronę! I bardzo dobrze.
Mamy tutaj wyraźne słodkie nuty takie jak: miód, karmel, toffii, masa krówkowa.
Przy kolejnym łyku do głosu dochodzi owocowość trunku. Beczka i wanilia wspaniale kontrują doznania.
Co raz przemknie przez kielich cytrusowa bardziej kwaśna nuta, ale zaraz ginie gdzieś w czeluściach słodyczy. Barley Wine chwilami przybiera charakter koniaku z jego owocową stroną.
Potężna oleista faktura, pełne ciało.
Goryczka delikatna, krótka owocowa. Alkohol wspanile dopieszcza do perfekcji każdy łyk.
Ależ to piwo jest pyszne! 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Klasa sama w sobie. Nie mam już zdrowia do tego de Molena. Ręce mi już opadają. Za każdym razem gdy biorę ich piwo do ręki, to każde kolejne wydaje się być lepszym od poprzedniego.
Po tej ilości piw, które od nich wypiłem wydaje mi się, że wygrywają starcie z takimi gigantami jak Mikkeller czy Nøgne Ø Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S. Przede wszystkim staram się wybierać ich piwa w różnych stylach i póki co nie uświadczyłem żadnej wpadki (poza dosłownie dwoma średnimi piwami).

Bommen & Granaten leżakowany jest w beczkach po hiszpańskim winie Rioja.
Wspaniły, głęboki armat drewna i wanilii wyczuwalny jest już z daleka. 
W aromacie wibrują kwaskowate nuty, które w smaku giną pod górą słodyczy. Potężne 30-to Ballingowe ciało budują akcenty owoców, cukru trzcinowego, miodu, karmalu, toffi i wina.
Dopieszczony alkohol łagodnie rozgrzewa, a gęsta lepka faktura cieszy zmysły.
Doskonałe piwo.

Taste is all of this, plus a note of sweet regret, the inevitable decay of all things... And vimto. Fruity, more wine notes on the finish. Excuse me, Im watching daredevil.

330ml bottle pours a murky amber orange color with a small off-white head that leaves some spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma is red wine grapes with caramel and grains. Taste is a caramel malty sweetness with a light hop bitterness and a dry red wine grape finish. Medium bodied with mild carbonation. A nice brew that suits the style well and I recommend others to sample this tasty beer.
Pours dark amber with a small soapy head. Intesne prune and caramel aroma, a bit of a sour touch to it as well. Medium body, quite harsch on bitters and tannins and a bitter toffee taste.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours darker amber with yellowish head. Aroma s sweet, toffee, butterscotch, aprcot, tropical sweet fruts, hay, caramel. Taste is sweet, caramel, toffee, sweet pale tropical fruits, something spicy, Full body. Sweet finish. Nice one.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 Pours dark amber color, clear, with tiny unstable off-white head, which immediately transform itself to a ring around the glass.
Visually low carbonation.
Aroma: rich aroma of malts, which takes on toffee, caramel, supported with woody notes of oaks, vanilla, rioja wine, and some notes of hops, which takes on liquoric, some citruses...
Flavor: intense malt flavors, which takes on caramel, molasses, toffee, vanilla, supported with slightly spicy hop flavors, which also takes on liquoric, citruses. Therere also detectable woody notes of barrels, vanilla, rioja wine, which steps forward right before finish. Finish is sticky dry. Body is full, texture is soft, carbonation is low. Alcohol warmth is gentle hidden, but still noticable. For sure best barley wines are aged in wine barrels and this is one of them!

Draught. Light hazy deep amber liquid with medium light tan head. Aroma of dried, oak, raw sugar, toffee, booze, red wine and red berries. Taste is very sweet and light bitter with notes of red berries, caramel, toffee, wood and raw sugar. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Quite oaky. Very high boost. Nice!
Pours amber with almost no head. Aromas of caramel, figs, dates, oak chips, red wine. Taste is quite sweet with malty caramel notes. Mouthfeel is quite sticky with low carbonation.

Tap @ Omnipollos Hatt. Hazy bright amber, thick and rich lacing tanned head. Big sweet vinous and woody nose, caramel, and vanilla. Very smooth and silky mouthfeel. Nice warming taste, oak, strawberry jam, vanilla, red wine with caramel and brown sugar.

Bottle from Biernavigatie. Hazy red/orange/amber colour, thin layer of creamy foam. Sweet nose of caramel, red wine, alcohol, honey. Light bitter. Nice and elegant sipper. Good.

Many thanks to my EU Secret Santa 2015!  Great fruity woody nose. The beer starts very easy to drink with fresh sourish-fruity hints of red wine and wood. Deep with nice complex wood and red-wine aroma. Not much bitterness, nicht fruity malty body, no roast! Great fresh combination - ideal for a red wine BA beer!

0,33 l bottle 
Dark Amber / copper color, hazy, minimal head, tan foam, caramel, banana, ripe / dried fruits, alcohol, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, orange, red fruit, berries and wine.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, orange, red fruit and berries; ends slightly dry with wine.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. So amazingly complex in its sweetness. The red wine is most definitely noticeable in it. Great aroma, appearance, and palate too. Outstanding beer thanks to that red wine barrel.

Dark colour, off white head. Aroma of red grapes, cream, vanilla, raisins, pear, quince and strawberries.Taste is medium sweet, slightly tart, fruits and red wine flavours. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Interesting barley wine.

On tap at NBF in Delft. Lovely barleywine. Quite viscous and sweet. Rioja barrel aging adds fruits and soft tannins. Wow!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle from....cant remember! Color is red to dark copper. Head is thin and white. Medium to high sweetness, low to medium bitterness. Medium body. Aroma is cherries, malt and chocolate. Flavour is red fruits, vanilla, chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, malt, bubblegum. Pretty tasty.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 Fles gekocht via De Molen Beershop, eerste die ik proef met wax op de hals, uitgeschonken in een glas van De Molen. Prachtig licht troebel warm koperkleurig bier, met een kortstondige, kleine beige schuimkraag.  Aromas van karamel, hout, pruimen, rozijnen, vanille en rode wijn. Aroma is zeker vineus, de rode wijn is duidelijk herkenbaar. De Smaak is minder zoet dan bij de normale Bommen & Granaten, duidelijk wat tannines van rode wijn en hout, ook fruitig, vooral pruimen, rijpe banaan en rozijnen. Carbonatie is zacht, body is licht olieachtig vrij complex. De afdronk is lang en droog met houtige rode wijn tannines. Zeker een geslaagde BA variant van de Bommen & Granaten, haalt echter nog niet het niveau van de oude 15,2% Bommen & Granaten. Alcohol is wel goed verborgen, de BA in de Rioja vaten heeft deze Barley Wine minder zoet en complexer gemaakt, met mooie wijntonen in zowel aroma als smaak. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beautiful deep red/copper beer with a white head. Sweet, syrupy malty barley wine with a mildly tart red wine finish. Really good.
Mooie oranje kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, crème, vanille, tikkeltje cognac. Smaakt fruitig, vanille, crème, vanille. Mooie fruitige barley wine.
Oranje koper bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt zoet, rood fruit, overrijp fruit. Smaakt rood fruit, vanille, zoet, siroop.

Van de tap @De Molen. Mooi roodbruin troebel bier met mooie schuimkraag. Zoetig, metalig aroma, smaken van mout, gedroogd fruit, beetje drop, rode wijn. De Rioja BA komt terug in de lichte rode wijnsmaak, niet overheersend dus. Het blijft een zoete Barley wat goed is.

Bottle brought back from an Amsterdam trip shared with Pix. Pours hazy ruby with a slight rim of off white froth. Sweet syrupy aroma with some stewed fruits. The taste has sweet stewed fruit to begin with along side some spice, butterscotch aniseed, liquorice and red wine in the finish. A very light sourness to it. The alcohol is warming but not overpowering. Excellent beer.
Pours hazy ruby in the glass with a small browny/white head. Vinegary nose. Massive amounts of golden syrup, warming on the throat. Tastes very alcoholic almost like a liquor. Bit too much for me.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear copper pour with a thin beige head, aroma has fortified wine, summer fruits and sweet caramel, taste has almonds, sweet fruits, caramel, quite boozy, with some vinous action.

330ml bottle. 25-12-2015.
BBD: 2040.
In short: sweet boozy ale.
Pours murky ornage with little off white head. Short head retention, poor lacing. Cheesy nose, along qith ripe fruit, raisins, malty, toffe, caramel, spicy. Full bodied, soft carbonation, viscous texture. Taste is quite sweet, malty, caramel, buttery, some liquor notes, ripe fruit. Enjoyable.
Borefts 2015, Day one. Tap. Funky plastic tegenvaller. Backlog from 2015/09/25.

Dark amber beer, clear at top but 2nd half of bottle with a lot of sediment. Minimal head.
Aroma: candy fruits- kaki sharon, orange, peach, sweet red wine, grapes, caramel.
Taste: big sweet with caramel and candy fruits, light sour from wine barrel, solid bitter for balance. Flavours similiar as in aroma, but more caramel, wine and some biscuits.
Palate: full body, low carbonation, warming up alcohol minimaly present on finish.
Overall: Good barley wine. It definitly might be alot better after year of more of cellaring, altough some barrel age notes might hide than.

On tap at NBF Winter Delft 2015. Clear, dark amber with a huge, creamy, tan head. Sweetish-malty aroma of raisins, molasses, caramel, vanilla, honey and hints of red grapes. Sweet, malty taste of raisins, honey, vanilla and caramel, followed by a short, slightly bitter, minimally vinous, lightly boozy finish. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, flat. Good! Not too much influence of the barrel which might be advantageous.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lion en jerommeke. Robijnrood met een crème kraag. Limonade.met een beetje basalmico azijn. Zuurtje in de afdronk.

On tap at Borefts Beer Festival day 2. Pours a hazy, reddish amber with a tiny, off white head. Aroma has caramel, vanilla, plums, prunes, fudge, slight fruity acidity. Taste is sweet, light acid, caramel, slight rum notes, port wine. Sticky body and a low carbonation.

Bottled. Pours clear and deep amber with a small, lacing off-white head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, dried fruit, wood and vanilla. Sweet flavor that ends up with alcohol and bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft to flat carbonation. A very nice barley. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Aroma: alcohol, licorice, wine, fruits, sweets
Appearance: orange, cloudy, minimal head
Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour
Palate: full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish
Overall: Very complex and massive beer

33cl bottle at home from de Molen, Bodegraven. Body is opalescent ruby brown, head is small, off-white, medium bubbles, average lasting, good lacing. Nose is red berries, multivitamin, flavor is red berries, multivitamin, herbs. Medium to heavy sweet, medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity medium sweet-sour, light alcohol warmth. Full body, oily sticky texture, very soft carbonation. Not too heavy, interesting fruity beer, I just miss the bitterness, great one though.

Butelka:
Piana niewielka, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa bursztynowo czerwona, mętna, sporo pływających drobinek drożdżowych. Aromat intensywny, beczkowy, zdominowany zapachem świeżego kokosa, w tle suszone owoce, ananas, winogrona, wino, wanilia... Poezja! W smaku słodkie z kwaskowym posmakiem, beczka oczywiście pozostawiła po sobie masę przyjemnych smaków - obok starego drewna, kokosa i wanilii pojawia się lekka winna cierpkość i szorstkość oraz oczywiście rodzynki, porzeczki, głóg, miód i karmel. Goryczka niska, alkohol idealnie ukryty, absolutnie nie czuć tu tych prawie 12%! Wysycenie niskie, treściwe, oleiste, przyjemnie aksamitne w odbiorze.
Jakże inne jest to piwo od wersji podstawowej - ile pozytywnych nut wniosła tu beczka to nie da się opisać. Dodatkowo piwo się pięknie ułożyło, zbalansowało i wygładziło, przez co stało się nieziemsko pijalne jak na ten woltaż! Zdradliwa i pyszna rzecz!

bottle at home. Pours dark amber with a small soapy head. Intesne prune and caramel aroma, a bit of a sour touch to it as well. Medium body, quite harsch on bitters and tannins and a bitter toffee taste. a bit of a bummer compared to the others
From tap. Pours cloudy amber to red with a small wjite head. Aroma is toasted malty and caramelish. Bitter, toasted and breadish. Breadish and roasted, dense malty finish.

Tap @ Borefts Beer Festival 2015. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of vanilla, citrus, malt, caramel, dark fruits, woody notes. Aromas of caramel, fudge, vanilla, prunes, toffee, citrus, ripe orange.

33cl bottle (11.9%, 30EBU, bottled 03-09-2015) pours with a hazy deep copper body that supports a light tan head of foam. The aroma offers up malts, molasses coated wood, cinnamon, floral hops, earthiness spicy cinnamon, plum, raisin and spicy red and black licorice. The taste starts with a wide array of flavors like plums, raisins, sweet berries, cinnamon, some spicy wood, black strap molasses and sweet malts. It just slides toward the finish unwavering in balance or depth. Solid smooth rich sipper.
Drank with Lennart in Amsterdam 24-10, from draft (?) at the Arendsnest. Very good beer. Really complex, lots of taste. Awesome.

Bottle (from Koht). Pours red amber with beige head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet and bitter, caramel, malt, slightly vinous. Flavor is sweet, bitter, strawbrries, caramel, malt, slightly sour, vanilla, oak. Alcohol is very well covered. Overall: great brew.

Hazy red amber, small off-white head. Nose is vinous, red berries, toasty malt, caramel notes, wood. Flavor is vanilla and strawberry, oak, vanilla, toasty malt, sweetness. Dry finish with strawberries and vanilla, caramel, alcohol, sweetness. Like eating strawberry ice cream with bourbon. Nice.

25th September 2015Borefts VII. Day 1. Keg. Hazy amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and mild fine carbonation. Thin but sweet malts. Tangy marmalade integrates well with the red wine berry fruits. Mild spice. Light finish. Not quite as rich as other B&Gs but it hangs together superbly well.

33cl bottle shared at home. Clear orange with a small white head. Full body with low carbonation. Heavy sweetness with subtle bitter tones. Ripe fruits, caramel, toffee, sugar and vine. Great full flavoured barley wine.

Tasted @ Borefts Beer Festival 2015. One of the best beers of the festival for me. The bommen & granaten goes so well with a wine barrel, the bordeaux was already awesome. This one is a little more drinkable and a little less sweet. Perfect balance and smooth as silk. Lovely.

The Rioja cask comes through very strident in fact it lends itself to a large part of the aroma. Warming sweetish and a little boozy, I guess it is a Barley Wine ish as the deScription suggests, I dont mind it but I think it is a little too flat for me. A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13 3.3

Boreft 2015. Opaque dark copper, small tanned foam ring. Sweet aroma and taste, smooth beer in drinking. Could get used to this. (Bodegraven 201509)

Sampled @ Borefts 15. Pours a hazy amber beer with a thin off white head on top. Aroma has boozy notes, big on the red wine or vineous characters, slightly oaky and very malty. Flavor is sweet, loads of booze in there, sugary and has a big vineous character in the aftertaste. Barrel ageing really completes this beer. Nicely done!

Hazy burnt amber, soft white ringed head. Nose is super sweet, caramel vinious - more like a dessert wine buzz but with a richness behind. Initial taste is lean sweetness and a lean drying maltiness - nothing overpowering. Carbonation is firm, steely and mouthfeel has a decent twist and long sipping richness. Finishes lean juicy grape, suprisingly bright and clementine with a caramel flurry on the linger. Keg, Taster @ Borefts Bier Festival 2015

Draught. Dark amber coloured. Dense light beige head. Aroma. Ripe fruits, sweetness, sugar, wood, syrup. Flavour. Sugar, sweetness, ripe fruits, wood, vanilla, herbs. Medium to full bodied. Ends sweet and fruity with a spiced touch.

Thx! for sharing. Sampled draft @ Borefts 2015. Day 1. I used to love Bommen & Granaten but the versions in recent years didnt appeal to me and I had quite a few unpleasant bottles. This one is not a full return but feels like the best on in years. Deep amber, small tanned head. Nose is thick warming caramel, oak, sweet banana, goop, sugar, rich, sweet, woody, decadent, no odd flavours, faint sweet desert wine. Taste is big sweet caramel goop, sugar, caramel, candy, thick, sweet sugary goodness, caramel, light oak, light touch of desert wine. Very thick body. Very solid. Simple but satisfactory, glad to have a partial return to form here.
Tap @ Borefts 2015. Amber color. Served too cold to fully enjoy this, Im afraid. Dried fruit and soft vinous notes in the aroma. Firmly hopped. Sweet with soft vinous notes. Oak, vanilla. Nice.

@Borefts 2015, wederom te koud van tap (gelukkig heb ik nog een flesje meegenomen voor thuis, kan ik hem op de juiste temperatuur drinken), caramel met licht kaki kraag.aroma van caramel, zoet, alcohol, mout, graan. Smaken zijn granig, alcoholisch, caramel, medium body, glad, lage co2,bevat meer complexiteit en smaak dan de PX variant.

On tap @ Borefts 2015, De Molen Bodegraven - NL. Color: amber brown beer with golden reflection no carbonation and medium clear brown head. Smell: sweet caramel and malt. Sugar domination, small alcohol finish.Taste: full body and sweet caramel domination. Cereal and barley taste. Good oily and sweet palate. Small alcohol finish. Aftertaste: alcohol finish, really sweet and caramel presence. Very nice beer.

Drank at Borefts 2015. Pours clear, dark amber. No real head. Smell is bitter, sweet, thick grains. Bit booze. Complex. Nice !
At Borefts 2015. Aroma of raisin, wine and caramel. Rich taste of raisin, buttery caramel, smooth vanilla and some mildly burned malt. Very nice.
